This potion is interesting because some of these give immediate value, some don't, and almost none of them are long-term scaling (excepting chrono boost). The best way to sum it up imo is that it's best in Elite fights, as they usually lack consistent frontload as well, so using it early in an elite fight to help solve it when you would otherwise have trouble is the play, I believe. It might be good enough for the act 1 boss as well.
It's similar to how you have to pop power potion or cultist potion early. You can't really rely on it in the moment unless you get lucky so you have to anticipate the need from the start.

embeds.title: YOU ARE MINE!
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 2 :energy_champ: / Boss / Downfall

Remove **Block** :p_block: from, and apply 3 (5) **Weak** :p_weak: and **Vulnerable** :p_vulnerable: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: It is a shockwave
Mainly just sad about my Together In Spire cheese
It was pretty funny tech while it lasts though
Albeit 30 block from one card is kinda insane tbh :watcherthink:

Usually I'm pretty happy to see this potion. It plays somewhat like a cross between a power/attack potion, as several options give you some form of scaling. You will usually need to use this early in a fight that you know is difficult for you and rewards scaling (many elites, transient). You could try to hold onto it for a boss fight and hope for one of the scaling powers (especially chrono-boost), but that is going to be unreliable.

Four cards that you can hit to keep in mind before using this potion are guardian whirl, invincible, chrono-boost, and prepare crush. All of those (and you are mine) benefit from popping this potion early in the turn/fight to know that you will have access to them and plan out your turn accordingly. You don't want to overblock on a turn where you draw invincible or prepare crush, and you want to make sure you spend your energy on blocking if you pull guardian whirl so that you can cast it. Last stand can also be important to know you have access to, as you might play more self debuffing cards, or be able to remove frail or vulnerable to help you mitigate damage.

Automa-Beam and guardian whirl are your best frontloaded options, but one requires being able to block enough, and they aren't a big enough portion of the pool to be reliable pulls. Shaper's blessing, and awaken are usually good enough to get value from the potion. You are mine and prepare crush are the most universally good picks, both are really helpful in tons of situations.

All that being said, I wouldn't normally buy this potion from a shop, just because of how unpredictable it's output is. Usually I buy potions to answer specific problems (aoe, scaling, frontloaded damage) and boss potion just doesn't do that.
